alert.note: Alert for Wilkin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 9:02PM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST TUESDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 11 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Wilkin County. In North Dakota, Ransom and Richland Counties. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 9 AM Tuesday to midnight CST Tuesday night. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Tuesday night through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
